thread.title: Last governor's race debate goes on without David Vitter
thread.title_full: Last governor's race debate goes on without David Vitter - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Last governor's race debate goes on without David Vitter
text:
By MELINDA DESLATTE
Associated Press BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) - The final TV debate among candidates for Louisiana governor was held without Republican U.S. Sen. David Vitter, though his GOP rivals made sure to point out his absence.
Wednesday night's event at LSU included Republican Public Service Commissioner Scott Angelle, Republican Lt. Gov. Jay Dardenne and Democratic state Rep. John Bel Edwards.
They talked about their support for higher education - and for stopping college cuts. Angelle and Dardenne also noted Vitter was missing.
Debate organizers said Vitter's campaign cited scheduling conflicts in Washington. It's the seventh TV debate in the race ahead of Saturday's election. Vitter attended two.
Vitter's opponents have accused him of skipping debates to avoid questions about his 2007 prostitution scandal. Vitter apologized for a "serious sin" after phone records linked him to Washington's "D.C. Madam."
